citations.narrative:
The current list of animals on hand does not contain the required information including dates of acquisition or disposition
of animals and required acquisition information including name and address where animal originated from. These records
need to be updated and maintained in a timely and accurate manner for record keeping purposes.

The facility does not have a developed and documented contingency plan that provides direction to provide for the
humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster.
The plan must identify situations that would trigger the need for a plan, and outline tasks and resources needed to put
plan into action to ensure the welfare of the animals is maintained in emergent situations.

**A section of the wood floor between the lemur enclosure and spider monkey enclosure is in disrepair and cannot be
cleaned and sanitized effectively. This section of the floor needs to be replaced and sealed to facilitate cleaning and
sanitizing of the facility.
**There is a metal pipe running up to the ceiling in the lemur enclosure that appears to have rust that is flaking off the
metal. This section of metal pipe needs to be addressed to keep the enclosure in good repair and to facilitate cleaning
and sanitizing of the enclosure.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
There is one capuchin housed in a part of the facility that does not allow him to see or hear the other non-human primates
located in a different room. This animal is taken into the main facility room for various periods of time to allow for an
introduction period, but there is no documentation in the enrichment plan to account for his situation or that these special
considerations and plan are in accordance with veterinary guidance. This needs to be documented as part of the
enhancement plan detailing the additional attention provided and plans to introduce him to a suitable conspecific.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within (2 ) more inspection(s) or by Dec 18, 2023, or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
